titles.title: To amend title 28, United States Code, to modify the residency requirement for United States attorneys and assistant United States attorneys.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Intellectual Property and Judicial Administration.

bill.summary: 3/29/1993--Introduced. Amends the Federal judicial code to modify the residency requirement to allow the U.S. attorney for the District of Columbia, the Southern District of New York, or the Eastern District of New York, to reside within 50 miles (currently, 20 miles) of the district for which he or she is appointed, and each assistant U.S. attorney to reside within 50 miles of such district.
